definitions: To get back or recover something that was lost, taken, or given away.
To bring land under cultivation or habitation from its natural state.
To rescue from an undesirable state; reform.
To demand the return or possession of something.
examples: She will reclaim her lost luggage.
They plan to reclaim the marshland for farming.
The program aims to reclaim young offenders.
You can reclaim the tax paid on the purchase.
